verses.verse: A Psalm<WH4210> of David.<WH1732> The LORD<WH3068> said<WH5002> unto my Lord,<WH113> Sit<WH3427> thou at my right hand,<WH3225> until<WH5704> I make<WH7896> thine enemies<WH341> thy footstool.<WH1916> <WH7272>
The LORD<WH3068> shall send<WH7971> the rod<WH4294> of thy strength<WH5797> out of Zion:<WH4480> <WH6726> rule<WH7287> thou in the midst<WH7130> of thine enemies.<WH341>

Thy people<WH5971> shall be willing<WH5071> in the day<WH3117> of thy power,<WH2428> in the beauties<WH1926> of holiness<WH6944> from the womb<WH4480> <WH7358> of the morning:<WH4891> thou hast the dew<WH2919> of thy youth.<WH3208>
The LORD<WH3068> hath sworn,<WH7650> and will not<WH3808> repent,<WH5162> Thou<WH859> art a priest<WH3548> forever<WH5769> after<WH5921> the order<WH1700> of Melchizedek.<WH4442>
The Lord<WH136> at<WH5921> thy right hand<WH3225> shall strike through<WH4272> kings<WH4428> in the day<WH3117> of his wrath.<WH639>
He shall judge<WH1777> among the heathen,<WH1471> he shall fill<WH4390> the places with the dead bodies;<WH1472> he shall wound<WH4272> the heads<WH7218> over<WH5921> many<WH7227> countries.<WH776>
He shall drink<WH8354> of the brook<WH4480> <WH5158> in the way:<WH1870> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> shall he lift up<WH7311> the head.<WH7218>
